meanings.definition: To completely destroy or demolish a building or structure.
meanings.sent1: The construction crew was razing the old house to make room for a new park.
meanings.sent2: The city decided to raze the abandoned factory to make space for a new shopping center.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended they were razing a giant castle made of sand at the beach.
meanings.sent4: The storm came through, razing everything in its path like a powerful force of nature.
meanings.sent5: The wildfire spread quickly, razing acres of forest in its wake.

meanings.definition: The act of tearing down or leveling a building or structure.
meanings.sent1: The razing of the old church was necessary to build a modern office building.
meanings.sent2: Witnessing the razing of the historic theater was a sad moment for the community.
meanings.sent3: The children's game involved the imaginary razing of a cardboard box fort.
meanings.sent4: The razing of the old bridge symbolized the town's progress towards a new era.
meanings.sent5: The controlled razing of the building was done carefully to avoid any accidents.
